reviews.review: This game is incredible in every way.  I'm blown away by it.

Действительно одна из лучших игр последних лет. Стоит пройти даже тем, кто не любит шутеры. Атмосфера и сюжет 10 из 10.

An absolute delight for the player who wants to get both the excitement of a fast paced shooter and the depth of a really well written story. The story grabs you, shakes you about and leaves you wanting more of this eminent game series. Game of the year 2013, not a doubt in my mind.

Enredo complexo, atmosfera envolvente, belíssimos cenários, combate frenético e brutal: essas são algumas características que marcam Bioshock Infinite.

O enredo aborda a busca de um veterano por uma moça que deveria ser usada como um meio de pagar suas dívidas com seu devedor, mas o que deveria ser um objetivo já não tão simples, se torna ainda menos. Exatamente o oposto dos títulos anteriores, a nova cidade explorada em Infinite está nos ares, viva e radiante, e também bastante hostil. O desenrolar da história gera situações ainda mais confusas que só poderão ser entendidas com atenção total à trama, que possui elementos interessantes e com a loucura característica de um Bioshock.

O motor gráfico utilizado é uma versão bastante modificada da Unreal Engine 3, e que por sinal, foi muito bem aproveitada: os cenários e modelos são muito bem trabalhados, e a iluminação e efeitos proporcionados pelo motor incrementam ainda mais a visualização do universo do jogo, o nível de detalhes chama a atenção.

A jogabilidade mantém o tiroteio frenético junto ao uso de poderes sobrenaturais, uma combinação letal e essencial no jogo. A troca de armas e habilidades místicas é mais intuitiva e dinâmica e há uma variedade maior no arsenal. Além do combate aprimorado, a nova cidade de Bioshock Infinite, por planar nas nuvens, apresenta trilhos que fazem com que você possa se locomover rápidamente pela cidade e te da uma vantagem estratégica no combate, algo criativo e divertido, fora a ajuda de sua companheira, que pode mudar os rumos da luta.

A trilha sonora também é rica, os sons ambientes não deixam a desejar e as músicas tocadas em combate combinam bem com o estilo do jogo, fora a adição de algumas músicas de compositores clássicos como Chopin e Mozart, que também dão um clima ao contexto do jogo.

Sem receios, Bioshock Infinite é mais um título de ótima qualidade da série, obrigatório para os fãs e fácilmente indicado para o público em geral, especialmente para os apreciadores de jogos de tiro em primeira pessoa.
This game is amazing in every way.  If don't stop playing until you get to the end and pay close attention to the story you will have on of the best gaming experiences EVER!!!  Get this now!
Good game.  Quite enjoyable, they need to revamp the save system.  Would prefer on demand saves to checkpoints, checkpoint systems are terrible.

It's a solid game.  Combat gets boring quick though if you don't play on a hard difficulty.  Recommend using the 1999 difficulty code to start off on that.  It still seems rather easy if you're using the right weapons, gear, and vigors.  I definitely think this is way easier than Bioshock 1 on it's hardest difficulty.  Otherwise the story, visuals, and music are all amazing.  Takes roughly 12-14 hours to beat the game.  Recommend checking it out if you're a fan of Borderlands or previous Bioshocks.
Dad simulator infinite
Best damn game ever. Some would say short but this game is one of the best I've ever played. Get it.
A beautiful game with amazing story. MUST play !!
Incredible game! Worth playing, even if you haven't played the other 2 Bioshock games!
Generally fun play, with some tough points, story is a bit meh, and the ending is definelty not for me. Glad it wasn't longer so I didn't feel worse about wasting my time.
Un juego que te mantiene constantemente en la historia sin aburrirte y con un buen decenlace que con lo unico que te deja , ademas de una buena imprecion , es el deseo de volverlo a jugar.
That's... an ending that i didn't quite agree with.

This is truly a masterpiece, a GOD among games, within a few minutes of play it is sure to encapsulate your heart, there is no game that i could recommend more so spend the cash! You will not be disappointed.                9.9/10

Easily the best AAA title of 2013. Bioshock Infinite blends top notch story telling with fantastic, fastpaced, gameplay. The Skyhook traversing system adds to the already diverse combat system and compliments the swashbuckling pace of combat encounters. 

Where the original Bioshock was more of a horror genre shooter, and focuses on the player feeling that their power is limited, Infinite gives the player sense of empowerment and satifaction that would be dificult to top.
But a huge element setting Infinite apart is its fantastic writing. It is constantly intriguing and leaving the player asking what's arround the next corner. While there are parts of the story that tend to lean towards over complex concepts used for the convienence of advancing the more nonsensical parts of the plot, it isn't enough to really devalue your experiance or distract you from the overarching story. 

Without giving anything away, THE ENDING WILL STICK WITH YOU. Some people will love it, some will hate it, but there is no denying the overall impact of it, after the rollercoaster ride of the game. 

While many games in 2013 had great story telling, but only simply good gameplay, or the reverse of that, Infinite excelled in both catagories, and wove the gameplay into the narative, very smoothly making in central to the overall concepts at play in the plot as well.

When it comes to graphics, Infinite is gorgeous and atmospheric. It features brilliant attention to detail. The art direction creates sense of disonance with the violence of the game, that actually aids in pushing the overall themes and characterization at play. Enough said.

Buy it. Play it. You will be hard pressed to find a game will give you such a lasting and worthwhile experience. 

Side note the DLC is equally fantastic, if you want explore the world and the questions it leaves you with further.
Juegazo de los pies a la cabeza! El mejor de la triologia.
gEIL!!
Fucking godt spil med en fantastisk historie. Spil 1 og 2 før du starter på det selvfølgelig. Det er den bedste serie spil jeg har spillet.

If you haven't played any of the Bioshocks, it won't matter as this story is independant of the others.

This game deserved Game of the Year. Screw The Last of Us. That game was good, but it doesn't compare. BioShock Infinite changed the way I look at gaming. This game is full of rich characters, many social conflicts including racism and religion (just to name a good 1/100 of them), and an amazing storyline. The characters start out rich, and they only get better. This game is amazingly done, no matter how you look at it. The graphics are fantastic, even on the lowest settings. This game is one of those games that if you play again, you'll understand everything. The game's ending is going to change your life, so stick through the glorious ride that is BioShock Infinite!
Este juego es totalmente epico y rejugable al 100% , se los recomiendo espero poder comprar los dlc para continuar con la historia , gracias 2k games por esta obra maestra

Sin lugar a dudas, uno de los mejores juegos que he jugado en AÑOS. Es una obra maestra en mayúsculas que tiene de todo: personajes carismáticos y entrañables (esa Elizabeth me tiene loquito), una jugabilidad directa, sencilla y sin rodeos, un diseño artístico excepcional, una bso maravillosa y una narrativa madura que te enganchará desde el primer minuto de juego.

ME ENCANTA.

O jogo em sim é um dos melhores, porque consegue te envolver na estória do começo ao fim, conseguindo mesclar muito muito bem as partes de ações. Única ressalva é a questão da violencia apresentada no jogo. Tirando isso minha Nota é 10.
O jogo tem um final surpreendente.

Pontos Positivos:
Jogabilidade,
Estória,
Dinâmica,

Pontos Negativos:
Violência.
Очень крутая атмосфера графика супер все супер всем маст хэв!

A cinematic masterpiece of gaming, it's not so much the voice acting or the story that brings you in, but the lucid display of themes. The imagery is intertwined in such a subtle and subversive manner heretofore had not been attempted in games prior. The layering of civil war and civil rights subcontext via a pseudo historical narrative propell this otherwise good game into another stratosphere. The story it's self is solid and heartbreaking, the ending of the game was such an excellent risk, and the cards fell in exactly the right place. Heartbreaking, gripping, fun, awe inspiring, lush with detail. It would be impossible to take in all at once, simply stunning and the best game in the series.
No quick save feature. Total let down, with my time schedule can't play game with autosave with way too long stretch between them.
Finished the game on a non-Steam version and loved it. Well worth the time and money. Love the atmosphere and setting.

I'm a little late to the parade here, but this is indeed the best game I've played in a long, long time. The world was so beatiful and wonderfully built, I would have enjoyed the game even if there had been no actual fighting. Many of my other favorite games (Fallout 3, Mass Effect, Borderlands) have suffered from anti-climactic endings. I think it's rare to find a game where the ending can move you as much as the actual progression of gameplay, but Bioshock does it. Elizabeth is a character I'll remember, and her world is one I feel the nastolgic pain for, something I love and miss and know I can't go back to and experience the same way ever again. 10/10.

If you are expecting a game similar to Bioshock 1/2 then you will be mistaken. This game has similar features, ie, plasmids vs vigors, tonics vs clothing, and that's about it. The endings are poor, the game becomes repetitive quickly, and your partner Elizabeth is either beneficial or useless in combat depending on how well you play. Do not waste your money on this game or the DLC. If the game is on sale go for it, but replay Bioshock or even System Shock before playing Bioshock Infinite.

Bioshock Infinite is a perfect mixture of a simplistic shooter with fun twists as well as a compelling storyline. The evolving characters and range of difficulty makes the game engaging and very hard to put down. I highly recommend Bioshock Infinite to anyone looking for a good singleplayer FPS with a story.
Here is my [url=http://www.terminally-incoherent.com/blog/tag/bioshock-infinite/]3 part review[/url].

An insanely good game, with great gameplay dynamics(as usual with the Bioshock series), a very rich and complex story, and a very intriguing ending. The word "Infinite" in the title justifies it very well, though I'm not going to spoil it. I just played it through 3 times and through sleepless nights and mornings after them I can't say I regret a single moment.
Wonderful, breathtaking, good-looking, intelligent, and everything any fan of the Bioshock franchise would want in a game.

As much as i mourned the death of rapture, the backstory, scenery and overall feel of bioshock infinite more than makes up for the loss of our much loved underwater paradise.

Amongst the many improvements between the games, one of the more admirable features - which i am so glad the dev team decided to implement - was a vocal main protagonist. Booker is responsive to the situations/discussions he finds himself thrown into, which helps attain that sense of immersion developers strive to create. It does the job far better than any Gordon Freeman character ever could. Can't really talk about Booker without mentioning Elizabeth too :- the best AI companion i have ever seen in a game. The lengths the designers went to to make her feel as if she were a real companion, it's simply amazing. Cant really go into detail about the characters and storyline otherwise i'd be spoiling the game, but both are great and are fluid such that you just want to see what waits around the next corner... [spoiler] Most likely a bloody turret. [/spoiler]

My only general complaint about Bioshock infinite is that the worst thing about it is also one of its biggest strengths - it's completely different whilst being more or less exactly the same. Rapture? plasmids. Columbia? Vigors. Big daddies? Rapture. Handymen? Columbia. Rapture? Atlas/Eleanor. Colombia? Elizabeth. Civil war? Colombia & Rapture. A lot of the core elements feel as if they have just been reskinned and repackaged as something new - though ultimately they are pretty much some of the reasons i fell in love with the series. So if anything, it refreshed the franchise while retaining what i really held dear to it. Don't mistake the similarities as its only content however, as there are a fair few scenarios that you would never have expected to see in a bioshock game. Lets just put it like that.

As far as the little details are concerned, the top end graphics are beautiful, the combat is often mixed up in most situations and there are a few places you'll visit which will give you a hint of nostalgia. With the graphics though, its a killer for lower end machines even on lower settings. At least have the reccomended stats to have a reasonably enjoyable time.

To sum up, i'd definetely reccomend it to anyone thats played the previous games, even to the newcomers to bioshock (though you may not understand a few references hidden in the enviroments). Cant wait for the next installment ^_^

*EDIT - No longer waiting for next installment. Irrational Games is dead.
Highly recommended!
such an amazing game on so many levels
Good, although not innovative gameplay. Impressive visuals. The story is interesting, even though the 3rd act could have been better. Definitely worth playing.

Absolutely amazing game, you need this in your life. Story twists and turns, always with a hint of mystery there. Art is directed and brilliantly-excecuted, and the game looks very pretty, while not being hugely taxing on hardware. Combat is fun and fluid, with plenty of customization to suit your desired playstyle. And Elizabeth...oh Elizabeth, possibly the best female NPC since Alyx Vance.

One of the best games I've ever played, only beaten by Half-Life 2 IMO. Why are you still reading this? Buy it, and Burial at Sea. There are few ways you could better spend your gold.

Bioshock: Infinite hat eine geniale Story (Auch wenn sie recht verwirrend ist). 
Das Kampfsystem ist einfach gehalten und man hat eine große Auswahl an Waffen und Fähigkeiten. Für diese gibt es auch Upgrades,die man sich mit den Silver Eagles kaufen kann. 
Die Charaktere wurden mit viel Liebe gestaltet und es wurde darauf geachtet,dass Gebäude,Kleidungen,Musik etc. auf das Jahr 1912 abgestimmt sind (Bisschen Steampunk-Flair ist dabei,was ein super Pluspunkt ist!)
Die Grafik des Spiels ist auch schön,vielleicht nicht ganz realistisch,aber das juckt glaube ich keinen,der das Spiel gespielt hat ;)
Auf Licht- und Schatteneffekte wurde auch viel gemacht ,was das Ambiente ume iniges schöner gestaltet.

Ich kann dieses Spiel jedem empfehlen, weil die Story einen einfach umhaut .
Sowohl Shooteranfänger als auch Shooterprofis werden ihren Spaß an diesem Grandiosem Spiel finden :)
Номинировал на "Игра года"

Sensacional!

Há tempos não jogo um jogo tão maravilhoso como esse, personagens super carismáticos, personagens envolventes, gráficos lindos, jogabilidade ótima e uma historia simplesmente incrível, fazia tempo que eu não me empolgava tanto em um jogo, acabei de zerar, mas com certeza irei zerar pelo menos mais umas 2x!

Recomendadíssimo!

Hated the first one, don't know why I'd think this one would be better. The combat is very boring and generic, no weapon feels like it has any impact and the NPC seems so stupid. Hate the controller scheme. The story was too far fetched for me to be interested in. The choices you make have no real value other than make you think that was the case. The graphics seems nice at first, and I heard alot of people praise the game about the details of the environment, I do not understand what they are saying, alot of the time NPCs will do the same fucking move in an endless loop not minding your existense at all, they also look the same (NPCs), I'm not sure whether it has some kind of story wise meaning, but I don't care, it breaks the immersion 100%.

1/10 would not even watch Let's Play of.
Best game of 2013

A terrible dissapointment that had moderately redeeming qualities but was overall a waste of money as a pre-order.

It doesn't help that all of the trailers of what the game was going to be only makes what instead currently is hurt even more.
Одна из лучших игр в которые я играл,концовка взорвала мозг!

Overall: [b]9,5/10[/b]

First of all Bioshock Infinite has become one of my most top favourable personal games I have ever played. The trailer has attracted my attention first, then while watching it I was already impressed to get it. The trailer has shown me many things I would like to do in a game. Hook into skycranes and skylines and fly around with it for fun. The graphics require a beast of a GPU: By the incredible look of it, it's obvious to have some powerful hardware. And the pretty girl in the role has got me too XD. 
I was tired of wandering in the depts of rapture so did the developers expected. A city in the sky is something brand new to experience. The keypoints of what i especialy liked in Bioshock Infinite are:
+ The design of: Levels, sounds, graphics, storyline, foes... They are just... WONDERFUL! I can't explain it accurately enough!
+ The arsenal of the protagonist Booker DeWitt is reasonable big even if it may come limitted. Deal with it :) I did.
+ You have a range of Vigors (or Plasmids) to use. Each is special for something.
+ Love the pretty girl :) (not literally lol!) [spoiler]♥ Elizabeth ♥[/spoiler]
+ The lenght of the game is pretty long enough. This plus is missing on most singleplayer titles. I've beaten it in 12,8 hours. Remember, that i was NOT rushing trough the game like a speedrunner or some other gamers but i was going to explore, what the developers put behind the scenes and levels.
+ Liked the cutscenes with First-Person camera and animations. They are designed with much details and fairly-real movement-animation.
+ Liked the english voice acting. It's fitting almost perfectly.
+ Again I can not say enough, how much I liked the storyline... from the beginning especialy. It was actualy very touching. Almost indept touching...
+ Very interesting adventure
+ Okay you've got to trust me on this one, if I am going to tell more it is going to SPOIL and RUIN your gaming experience and fun!

Now to the negative sides:
- I miss one content. It's a spoiler! Avoid hovering your mouse here if you have not played Bioshock Infinite yet ([spoiler]My most favourite element plasmid is not available in this title. ICE. Icy warfare for me![/spoiler])
- Placeholder!!! As soon as I find something to complain about I will let the readers know.

When I have beaten the game I was sad :( i LOVED THIS GAME and i WANT MORE. No, no, no, no this can't be the end. The adventure can not end now! Ahhh damn it! It IS the end! I can only hope, that the next Bioshock Title won't be screwed.

This game is the epitome of hype. The graphics are outdated, the story is conveluted with TV and Movie cliche's and the gameplay has shown no evolution over the first two Bioshock games. I sunk 12 hours into this game, and truly got nothing out of it. This game once again proves the power of marketing, with it's high metascores and unbelievable sales. My main complaint is that there is no variation in the game, the enemies all behave the same, the powers all do the EXACT same thing, 1 projectile attack and 1 trap attack, the guns are completely unoriginal and have nothing noteworthy of interest, standard pistols, shotguns, submachineguns etc, and the characters are all one dimensional idiots with "dark pasts". I literally couldn't care less.  If you're looking for a cliche FPS game with cheap emotional plot points, then this is the gmae for you. If you genuinely value your time and money, play something else, I'd honestly rather play another shoveled out call of duty sequel than this appauling game.

0First off I almost never right reviews enless im righting a "beware to player" cluase so that they dont get there money tide up in a game thats not up there ally. This is not the case.... Bioshock Infinite is a must. It has all the makings of a game that will keep you griped onto the edge of your seat from the vairy moment you start playing. unlike BioShock 1&2 the story is vairy rich full of imagination and a over all sence of a deeper thought to the plot but with no spoilers. On top of that it is a (First Person Shooter) FSP for short. It flows smooth and the controles handle like a dream, (I play mine with a Xbox-360 controler so with a key board it will vary) And finaly we come to the graphics wich left me with my eyes gluid to the screen, it is vivid and sharp in all areas making this game not only atractive to the mined but to the eyes as well. As for scares and suspens in battle there are a few but for me there was only one that had me puase the game and colect my sences befor moving on. But for the most part it is vairy casual game play but has a way to blow your mined when you least expect it. And as for the rest, I look forword to buying the DLC's and playing them. Yes bioShock Infinite is a master piece and i would recomend it to anyone.
Great graphics, addicting story. buy it god damnit!

Played for 30 minutes.  Just random exposition and gameplay that was standard from 1997.

Got stuck on the environment.

Can I have the 30 minutes back?

Definitely one of the best plots and endings in recent video games. The atmosphere is very different from Rapture, but Columbia has an awesome personality of its own. Also, Burial at Sea is a fun revisit to Rapture and expansion of both universes.
Melhor só se realmente fosse infinito!

For a mass medium that depressingly is becoming more and more warped and perverse in its social values and ethics its extraordinary a game like Infinite ever made it to release.  So it may not deliver all the dark delights promised at preview it still remains an amazing artistic work  worthy of close examination.  It also plays well (although far less so than the original) and looks and sounds fantastic. A must buy.

Отличная игра! Интересный сюжет. Разнообразные бои. Разве только что слишком простые на среднем уровне сложности. Обычно игры к концу скисают, эта же переворачивает все с ног на голову. Не много игр я прошел до конца, но эту стоило.

This is a solid and refreshing FPS experience that truly rewards the completionist. The mechanics and the storyline are impressive - I want to replay the game now that I have finished the story, but due to the linear nature of the levels I might not. Maybe I'll buy Bioshock instead and check out the Rapture
